page.title: 03PIN MILL
page.content: Pin Mill is a small village situated in a bay of the River Orwell which provides shelter for yachts and barges. Its quiet and beauty has attracted artists and authors. Arthur Ransome and Arnot Robinson featured Pin Mill in their books. The house where Ransome wrote his children's books is still rented by holiday-makers. Edward Seago painted here and a mural by Z. Blakely of Sailing Barges is in the Pin Mill Sailing Club. Some cottages are near the Grindle which flows into the River Orwell,the rest are along the road to Chelmondiston. Most of the inhabitants are commuters or retired. Today Pin Mill is a sailing centre; yachts are moored in the river, and dinghies are launched from the Hard. One of the two boat-yards also repairs Thames Barges. The Butt and Oyster is now the only Pub here but it is very popular.
